verses.verse: By the rivers[b] of Babylon we sat down and wept when we remembered Zion.
[c]There on the poplars we hung up our harps.
For it was there that our captors asked us to sing them a song, and, tormenting us, demanded a joyful song: “Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”
But how could we sing songs of the LORD while living in a foreign land?[d]
[e]If I forget you, O Jerusalem, may my right hand fail me.
May my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I do not remember you, if I do not regard Jerusalem as the greatest of my joys.
[f]Remember, O LORD, the cruelty of the Edomites on the day when Jerusalem fell,[g] how they shouted, “Tear it down! Tear it down to its very foundations!”
O Daughter[h] of Babylon, you destroyer, happy will he be who repays you for the suffering you inflicted upon us!
Happy will he be who seizes your babies and smashes them against a rock![i]
